comments:
I have profiled traces saved in a opened Hyades perspective.
When I launch workbench and I close it without profiling a new application
I got the following exception:

Unhandled event loop exception
Reason:
Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)
*** SWT nested exception
Reason:
java.lang.NullPointerException

(Un?)fortunetly this exception doesn't appear if I profile a application.
I now this smell really strange...

I'm currently using Hyades sources update today (03 june 04)
over IES-I-I20040514-200405141501-win32.
And I made test using new workspace.

Here are reported log. :

I can't reproduce this. Does this happen consistently? I mean, if you don't 
profile, then it always happen, but if you do, then it never happens?

I just got this error (build 20040610-0800) in a stock Eclipse SDK. I had 
closed a number of perspectives (java browsing and java heirarchy) all but 
one "Java" and then exited.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 66498 ***

UIPlugin.getActiveWorkbenchWindow() should be compared to null before getting 
the active page (line 108 of AbstractListenerActionDelegate).

Created an attachment (id=12844)
Patch from Sylvain

I can reproduce this quite easily.  On new workspace, profile an external 
application.  Use the Execution History profiling type with the defaults.
After terminating the run, bring up the method statistics view.  Then close the 
method statistics view.  From the profiling monitor, save the project.  Exit 
the workbench.  

Now, bring up Eclipse again.  Without opening a Profiling View, exit the 
workbench.  You will get the exception.

I applied Sylvain's patch and I no longer get the NPE on exception.
